maqras.text: What are they asking one another
About the most important topic [of Resurrection]
Concerning which they differ
No, they will soon come to know
No, no, they will soon come to know [the Truth]
Have We not made the earth specially prepred [for sustenance of life]
And the mountains as stabilisers
And We created you in pairs
And We made your sleep a means of rest
And We made the night as cover
And We made the day for earning a livelihood
And We have built above you seven strong [firmaments/heavens/atmospeherioc layers]
And We have made a blazing source of light
And We send water pouring down in abundance from the rain-bearing clouds
So that We may produce therewith grain and vegetation
And gardens luxuriant
Indeed, the Day of Decision is a divinely appointed time
When that Day the trumpet is blown, you come out in droves
And the heaven is opened as if it were gates
And the mountains are moved away, as if they had been a mirage
Indeed, Hell is waiting
As home for the transgressors
They shall remain therein for ages
They shall taste therein neither coolness nor any drink
But boiling water and a pus-like thing
An appropriate recompense
They never expected to be called to account
And they falsely rejected Our signs/Verses
And We have recorded everything in a Book
So taste now [the punishment;] for, now, We shall increase on you nothing but punishment
Indeed, for the pious ones, there is salvation
[They shall be in] gardens and vineyards
And [with] likeable companions
And cups filled to the brim
They shall not hear any idle talk, or any lies, therein
[Their life in the Hereafter] will be a reward from your Lord, a measured gift
The Lord of the heavens and the earth and all that lies between them, the Gracious! None shall have it in their power [in His presence] to address Him
The Day the Spirit and the angels stand in rows, none shall speak except those whom the Lord of Mercy permits, and who will say only what is right
That Day is sure to come. So let him, who wishes to, take the right path to return to his Lord
We have warned you of Punishment that is near. The Day when it comes, man shall see what his hands had sent ahead, and he who has suppressed the Truth shall say, "Oh, would that I were dust
By those that dive and extract
And by those [winds?] that briskly pass by
And by the floaters [clouds?] that float by
And then overtake others, leaving the latter behind
And then execute a [divine] Order [to rain]
[There shall come] a Day when a violent convulsion will convulse [the world]
The subsequent convulsion shall follow the first
Hearts that Day will be throbbing
Sights that Day will be lowered
They ask, "Shall we be brought back to life [after death]
Even when we are crumbled bones
They say, "This in that event would be a damaging return
It will but be a single blast
And then they all will come awake [from their deep slumber of death]
Has Moses' story come down to you
When his Lord called out to him by the sacred valley of Tuwa
Go to Pharaoh! He has indeed exceeded all bounds
You then ask him, `Would you like to reform
Would you allow me to guide you to your Lord, so that you fear Him
Moses then showed him the great Sign [staff turning into snake and hand turning white]
But he [Pharaoh] refused to acknowledge the divine Sign and obey Allah
He then turned his back hastily
To summon and collect his people
He then proclaimed to them, "I am your lord supreme
Allah then seized him for punishment both in the Hereafter and here
There is indeed a lesson in this for those who fear Allah
Are you more difficult to create or the heaven to construct
HE raised its structure and then balanced it aright
And made its night dark and its day bright
And the earth thereafter â€” He spread it out
He brought out from it its water and its pasture
And He made the mountains firm
[He has provided] means of sustenance for you and your animals
So when the great event occurs
That Day man would recount what he strove for
And the Hell would be made manifest for all to see
And then anyone who had transgressed divinely set bounds
And had preferred the life of this world
That one's abode shall indeed be in Hell
And one who had been afraid of standing before his Lord and had restrained one's self from carnal desires
That one's abode shall indeed be in Paradise
They ask you [Prophet] about the Hour (the time when the present world will end and the Hereafter begin), "When is it coming
What have you to do with the mentioning of it [the time of the occurrence of the Hour]
With your Lord rests the final and only Authority to know when the Hour would happen
You [Prophet] are but a warner for those who fear it [the Hour]
The Day they see it [the Hereafter], they will feel as if they had stayed for only one evening or one morning thereof
